substitute_tokens.py - substitute fields in tables¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This script substitutes the elements within columns within an table.

Usage¶

Example:

python substitute_tokens.py --help

Type:

python substitute_tokens.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: substitute_tokens.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -c CREATE, --create=CREATE
                        create substitution list [none]
  -r REGEX_TOKEN, --regex-token=REGEX_TOKEN
                        regular expression for tokens (has to create one pair
                        of brackets) [none]
  -p PATTERN_SUB, --pattern-sub=PATTERN_SUB
                        pattern for substitution [%s]
  -a APPLY, --apply=APPLY
                        apply substitution list [none]
  -x, --extended        replace not just with second column in map, but all
                        columns. [False]
  -i, --invert          pairs of substitution patterns is to,from [False]
  -m, --multiple        do multiple substitutions per row [False]
  -e, --echo            echo susbstituted column [False]
  -k, --keep            keep column that is substituted [False]
  -f, --filter          remove lines not matching [none]
  -y, --reverse-filter  remove lines matching [none]
  -n, --inplace         do inplace subsitutions of all files on command line
                        [False]
  -b, --backup          keep backup (with ending .bak) [False]
  --keep-header         do not apply transformation to header [False]
  -o COLUMNS_TOKEN, --columns-token=COLUMNS_TOKEN
                        substitute tokens in columns [none]
  -s REGEX_ROWS, --select-rows=REGEX_ROWS
                        regular expression for rows to use. [none]
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
